content.description: Start the same as Nuclear. Bump right to a sloper, move your feet, then bump right to a good sloper. Bump your left foot up to a good edge, and rock up to sloper. Bump left to a jug, and mantel the top out.
content.location: It is on the left side of Atomic Boulder.

content.description: The grade is a total guess. I have not climbed this.Sit start on a good open-handed hold in the horizontal crack, and work your way up using shallow crimps and maybe a sloper. It should be over once you hit a good crimp rail that's up and left.
content.location: On the graffiti-ed face, it is just to the left of a dead tree.

content.description: Sit start on a slopey edge that looks like it was made.  It goes straight up to a slopey pinch. It is a one move wonder problem.  It is fun nontheless.
content.location: This is on the left side of Atomic Boulder.

content.description: The grade is an estimate. I have not climbed this.Sit start on a good, open-handed hold, and traverse the entire horizontal crack from right to left. The crux is finding feet for the first half of the climb.
content.location: This is on the face with graffiti. Start to the left of a dead tree.

content.description: Stand start with your hands matched on blocky hold. Deadpoint to the lip, and mantel the topout.
content.location: This is on the face with graffiti. Locate the good, blocky hold about chest height.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand in the crack and your right hand on low arete hold. Find the jugs up top. Blocks underneath are off for your feet.
content.location: This is on a boulder to your left as you approach Atomic Boulder and ascends a short, little crack.

content.description: Start with both hands on decent sidepulls, and work your way to the line of good crimps. From there, match at the obvious horizontal crack, and mantel the top out. A sit start could make this V1.
content.location: On the Atomic Boulder, it is to the left of Summer Time Blues and Nuclear.

content.description: Start on the farthest right holds in the crack.  Follow left to the top of the boulder.
content.location: This is on the front of Atomic.

content.description: Start on the holds marked in the beta photo, and climb straight up.
content.location: It is to the right of Summer Time Blues.

content.description: From the crimps on Atomic Traverse, fire up to the good jug at the lip.
content.location: This utilizes a short dyno from the seam.

content.description: This is a good boulder with some fun problems on it.  It is a good after work spot as it is closest to the road.
